text:
Pascal Kané (January 21, 1946 – August 31, 2020) was a French movie director, screenwriter and actor. He was on the editorial staff of Cahiers du Cinéma from 1969 to 1979. He taught cinema at Université Paris III.
He was known for directing and writing "Liberty Belle". He starred in "India Song" and "The Suspended Vocation". He was born in Angoulême, Charente.
Kané died on August 31, 2020 at the age of 74.
